The Temperatures recorded at our Winter
Quarters have led to the interesting discovery that 
Mercury continues to contract below its freezing point 
(page 15), and in view of all the circumstances it does 
not seem improbable that the routine use of Mercury 
thermometers should be recommended to future polar 
Expeditions. 
The station barometer was kept in the deck 
house because it was impossible to find a space in the 
cramped living quarters where it would have been free 
from the danger of injury; it was recognised that a 
difficulty would be involved in the limited range of the 
attached thermometer and the suggestion that the position 
was chosen in ignorance of this fact is inaccurate. 
The Meteorological Volume does not give the 
readings of the attached thermometer; it does give the 
corrected readings of the barometer in the coldest 
weather without comment (vide page 205). Without the 
original records I cannot say with certainty but I 
believe (1) that the temperature of the deck house was 
rarely below the limit of the attached thermometer. 
(11) that on all such occasions data were provided 
whereby a temperature correction could be obtained.
